analysis_disability: Specifying that the candidate must be "physically fit & healthy" could be seen as potentially discriminatory against individuals with disabilities, depending on the nature of the required tasks and whether reasonable accommodations could be made.
analysis_racial: The mention that "Some fabrication experience and Samoan language skills would be an advantage but not necessary" could imply a preference for candidates who speak Samoan, which may not be essential for the role. This could deter non-Samoan speakers from applying, even though the skill is stated as non-essential.
text: Growing organisation seeking 3 mechanical minded applicants to join our hard-working Warmington Team in our East Tamaki production facility, full time hours Mon-Thu 7. 00 - 5. 30pm, with overtime on Fridays when required. Warmington Industries is a wholly NZ owned manufacturer of industry leading design and bespoke wood and gas premium fire products for residential and commercial New Zealand market. The ideal applicants will have previous assembly, sheet metal, welding, spray painting experience or know your way around a tool box and are seeking Full Time work. We provide on-going training in our skills base and encourage staff to further education through light gauge sheet metal apprenticeship, so if this sounds like you get in touch. About the Role. You will be part of a team that is responsible for the accurate production of light gauge sheet metal components, including cutting, bending, welding, spray painting, assembly and final packaging of premium quality products. Some fabrication experience and Samoan language skills would be an advantage but not necessary. You will be using a range of hand tools, power tools and measuring instruments, along with using various metal joining techniques, bolting, and riveting. You will also be studying blueprints, drawings, and specifications to determine job requirements. You are someone who takes pride in your work, be able to get along with all other members of our team and as these are 'hands on' positions, you will also need to be physically fit & healthy, show initiative and be able to work unsupervised. Attention to detail and accountable for the work that you do. Utilise your initiative to work unsupervised with attention to detail. Excellent listening and learning skills – open to new ideas and coaching. Reliable and physically fit team player. Able to work overtime if required. NCEA Level 1 mathematics and English is the minimum requirement for this position. Own transport is essential. Your positive/open attitude, strong interpersonal skills, work ethic, reliable nature and team focus combined with your integrity, punctuality and well organised approach will be valued here. These roles are a fantastic opportunity to develop your general engineering and fabrication skills in a supportive and friendly environment. Applicants must have NZ residency or valid NZ work visa. Work hard as part of our team, and you will be rewarded with competitive rates and great work environment. If you are ready for a change, send through your CV and we will be in touch.

{"document_id": "Kaggle::techmap::61378652f2fd7421561f68e8::seek_nz", "source": "seek_nz", "country": "NZ", "company": "Warmington Ind 1994 Ltd", "position": "Assembly & Process worker", "notes": "", "original": "

Growing organisation seeking 3 mechanical minded applicants to join our hard-working Warmington Team in our East Tamaki production facility, full time hours Mon-Thu 7.00 - 5.30pm, with overtime on Fridays when required.

Warmington Industries is a wholly NZ owned manufacturer of industry leading design and bespoke wood and gas premium fire products for residential and commercial New Zealand market.

The ideal applicants will have previous assembly, sheet metal, welding, spray painting experience or know your way around a tool box and are seeking Full Time work.

We provide on-going training in our skills base and encourage staff to further education through light gauge sheet metal apprenticeship, so if this sounds like you get in touch.

About the Role

You will be part of a team that is responsible for the accurate production of light gauge sheet metal components, including cutting, bending, welding, spray painting, assembly and final packaging of premium quality products. Some fabrication experience and Samoan language skills would\u00a0be an advantage but not necessary.

You will be using a range of hand tools, power tools and measuring instruments, along with using various metal joining techniques, bolting, and riveting. You will also be studying blueprints, drawings, and specifications to determine job requirements.\u00a0

You are someone who takes pride in your work, be able to get along with all other members of our team and as these are 'hands on' positions, you will also need to be physically fit & healthy, show initiative and be able to work unsupervised.

You will also need to show the following attributes:

  • Attention to detail and accountable for the work that you do.
  • Utilise your initiative to work unsupervised with attention to detail.
  • Excellent listening and learning skills \u2013 open to new ideas and coaching.\u00a0
  • Reliable and physically fit team player.
  • Able to work overtime if required.

\u00a0NCEA Level 1 mathematics and English is the minimum requirement for this position.

Own transport is essential.

Your positive/open attitude, strong interpersonal skills, work ethic, reliable nature and team focus combined with your integrity, punctuality and well organised approach will be valued here.

These roles are a fantastic opportunity to develop your general engineering and fabrication skills in a supportive and friendly environment.

Applicants must have NZ residency or valid NZ work visa. Work hard as part of our team, and you will be rewarded with competitive rates and great work environment.

If you are ready for a change, send through your CV and we will be in touch. For a confidential discussion about the role, please contact Phil at 09 271 0891 [link removed]
